date: “I typically deploy the following two rules on every web project that I work on:

1. 301 all requests with no subdomain specified to the www. equivalent of the URL (e.g. a request for london2012.com should 301 to www.london2012.com and a request for london2012.com/sports should 301 to www.london2012.com).

2. 301 all requests with uppercase characters to their lower case equivalent. (e.g. a request for www.london2012.com/Sports would redirect to www.london2012.com/sports) - before implementing this ensure that canonical URL can only be specified with lower case characters.
Simple Apache rules exist to implement this logic. Once the rules are in place a request for london2012.com/Sports would redirect to www.london2012.com/sports.”
